fields.headline: For the record
fields.bodyText: Apologies to readers baffled in their attempts to match four couples in the picture quiz Who's Whose (Observer Magazine). The eight people were correctly captioned on page 35 but then appeared happily paired up with entirely different names (inadvertently repeated from an earlier example) in the solution on page 78. Sorry. The statue on the fourth plinth in Trafalgar Square last year was of Sir Keith Park, commander of 11 Group Fighter Command, which defended London in the Battle of Britain, not, as we said in On my Radar (New Review), a single figure of a Bomber Command pilot. Apologies. A graphic in Business showed no women in the boardroom at BAE Systems. However, Linda Hudson was appointed in October 2009 as an executive director and is president and CEO of BAE Systems Inc. "Obama under fire" (Newst) described Newt Gingrich as a "New York Republican congressman". He is a former representative from Georgia. Homophone call: "Tellingly, he [Lee Cattermole] had escaped uncensored for his part in an arguably far more dangerous aerial challenge." (Sport). Write to Stephen Pritchard, Readers' Editor, the Observer, Kings Place, 90 York Way, London N1 9GU, tel 0203 353 4656 or email reader@observer.co.uk
